steps.title: Launch & landing page
details: Every test starts with the user opening https://invoify.vercel.app.
The landing page usually renders, but UI-review repeatedly flags minor style issues (mis-aligned labels, inconsistent padding, vague placeholder text, button style drift).

steps.title: Trying to start Invoice Wizard – Step 1 (Bill From / Bill To)
details: Users expect the wizard to open on Step 1.
Both ‘Bill From’ and ‘Bill To’ sections fail to appear within 5 s, so the journey stops before any data entry.
Hard failure source: component not mounted or selector mismatch.

steps.title: Template system (choose template / upload logo)
details: Landing page header never becomes visible → template choices not reachable.
Logo-upload option cannot be found once page loads → user cannot brand their invoice.

steps.title: Live preview (real-time data & step sync)
details: User successfully types full Bill From / Bill To data and sees it in preview (good).
When they change values, at least one field (‘Zip’ in test) does not re-render → trust in “live” preview drops.
Navigation buttons (‘1 . From & To’) sometimes unclickable, so preview cannot sync with wizard steps.

steps.title: Signature features (draw, type, upload)
details: Canvas for drawing signature, typed-signature field, and upload area are all missing or not visible → user cannot add any signature.

steps.title: Line-item calculations
details: ‘Line Items’ section never appears, so quantity × price totals cannot be tested.

emotional_arc: Hopeful when the app loads → immediate confusion when key sections never show up → irritation as repeated refreshes/time-outs occur → partial relief when live preview works for initial input → frustration returns when edits don’t update and other core features (templates, signatures, calculations) simply aren’t there → loss of confidence / abandonment.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Critical UI elements not rendering (wizard sections, signature areas, templates, line-items)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Blocks users from completing primary tasks; leads to instant churn.
next_actions: Audit component mounting & conditional rendering logic; ensure sections always mount even if data is empty.
Add robust loading states / skeletons so users know something is happening.
Implement automated smoke test that asserts presence of every major section on first paint.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Selector / label mismatches causing automated & human findability issues
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: If automation can’t locate ‘Bill From’, real users may also miss it; inconsistent labels hurt accessibility.
next_actions: Standardise text labels (‘Bill From:’ not ‘Bill From  :’) and use semantic headings.
Expose test-friendly data-attributes (e.g., data-testid) to decouple DOM changes from selectors.
Run accessibility audit for ARIA landmarks so sections are discoverable by assistive tech.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users rely on WYSIWYG feedback; stale data undermines trust and can generate billing errors.
next_actions: Track down state propagation for every field; add unit tests for each field–preview binding.
Throttle/debounce input updates if performance is a concern, but guarantee final value sync.
Show ‘out of sync’ indicator when binding fails.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Visual consistency (spacing, alignment, button styles, placeholder copy)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Polish signals reliability; inconsistent UI makes the product feel unfinished and distracts from the task.
next_actions: Adopt a design-system/utility-class approach (e.g., Tailwind spacing scale).
Normalize button component variants and enforce via linting/storybook.
Replace lorem or vague placeholders with real examples (e.g., “Acme Co.” instead of “Name”).

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: A legally binding invoice must be signable; absence forces users to seek other tools.
next_actions: Verify signature feature flags aren’t accidentally off in prod build.
If feature is not yet supported, hide menu entries and communicate roadmap.
Add fallback typed name + timestamp if canvas unavailable.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users can’t progress, review, or edit steps.
next_actions: Increase hit-area and ensure buttons are enabled once current step validation passes.
Use sticky progress bar so navigation is always visible.
Log navigation errors in analytics to catch in production.

first_tackles.description: Guarantee core sections mount on initial load (Bill From, Bill To, Line Items, Signature, Template chooser). Smoke-test nightly.
Introduce stable data-testids & clean up heading/label text so both users and automation can reliably find elements.
Fix state binding for live-preview updates (start with fields that currently fail like Zip/Address).
Apply global spacing & button style tokens to resolve majority of ‘looks off’ UI-review flags quickly.
Hide or clearly mark unfinished features (signature types, logo upload) until fully functional to avoid user confusion.
